comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
A Newport socialite named Miss Edith Mortimer married Count Mario di Zoppola, an Itaiian aviator, in 1919, at her parents' country home in Wheatley Hills.  Her mother was Eleanor Roosevelt's aunt.  The Count and Countess di Zoppola divorced at Reno in 1929.   In 1937, Cole Porter was badly injured while riding at Edith di Zoppola's Oyster Bay estate.

Miss Mortimer seems to be enjoying "chair skating"?

A G. MacCulloch Miller was mentioned winning a "toboggan challenge plate" in a winter sports event at Tuxedo Park in 1913.   (George MacCulloch Miller had a daughter Edith too, but she announced her engagement in 1902.)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Looks like a better way to "skate," with less risk of falling.


LOC: Spelling error: MacCulloch has an "a" in it.
